description: Arrhythmogenic cardiomyopathy is a heart condition that can lead to abnormal heart rhythms. Diagnosing this condition can be challenging, especially when imaging results are inconclusive or when patients have a history of frequent premature ventricular contractions (PVCs).
you_have_this_if: Previous catheter ablation procedures have not provided a clear diagnosis.
There is a family history of arrhythmogenic cardiomyopathy.
Patients exhibit symptoms like palpitations or syncope.

approaches.best_for: When diagnosing patients with frequent PVCs and inconclusive imaging results.
approaches.key_tradeoff: EAM provides detailed mapping but may require specialized equipment and expertise.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need a precise diagnosis for patients with inconclusive imaging and frequent PVCs.

start_here: Start with Electroanatomic Mapping (EAM) as it provides detailed insights for diagnosing arrhythmogenic cardiomyopathy, especially in complex cases.
